p: A more conventional (Kim et al. 2012; Gonzalez and Goddard 2016) presentation of deterministic hindcast skills is shown in Fig. 5 in which the ESMs’ skills are also compared with persistence (auto-correlation of observed indices at various lead times). Figure 5 also shows RMSEs of ESMs in hindcasting DCV indices. The color bars in Fig. 5a, c, e show correlation coefficients between the observed DCV index and the ensemble-average hindcast index from each ESM and the MME; ranges of correlation coefficients between the observed index and index from each ensemble member are shown as vertical black lines on each color bar. The ESM associated with each color bar is identified in Fig. 5f. The black line connecting stars in Fig. 5a, c, e is the auto-correlation coefficient of each observed DCV index. Dashed and solid horizontal lines in Fig. 5a, c, e denote 95 and 99% confidence thresholds, respectively. Figure 5b, d, f show RMSEs of hindcasts, where the color bars show the errors in ensemble-average and vertical black lines show ranges of errors in ensemble members.
